snippet: Susan E. Rice, in her six weeks as national security adviser, has dealt with a terrorist scare, deteriorating relations with Russia and, now, the chaos in Egypt.
abstract: Susan E Rice, in her six weeks as national security adviser, has dealt with a terrorist scare, deteriorating relations with Russia and, now, chaos in Egypt; some analysts wonder if Rice, former United Nations ambassador, will bring a more muscular, idealistic cast to Pres Obama's foreign policy; she has reputation as outspoken defender of human rights and advocate of American intervention to prevent abuses.
lead_paragraph: Susan E. Rice, in her six weeks as national security adviser, has dealt with a terrorist scare, deteriorating relations with Russia and, now, the chaos in Egypt.

headline.main: Thrust Into Nonstop Turmoil, an Obama Adviser Counsels Pragmatism
headline.print_headline: Thrust Into Nonstop Turmoil, an Obama Adviser Counsels Pragmatism

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
